parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>FALSE</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>TRUE</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>TRUE</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>TRUE</electoral-objective>
<journalism>FALSE</journalism>
<personal_opinion>FALSE</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1125773355569863</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
This Facebook post, paid for by MozaiQ, presents excerpts from various political parties' platforms regarding women's and LGBTQ+ rights. While it doesn't explicitly advocate for or against any specific candidate, it highlights stances that could influence voters' choices.  The inclusion of quotes from candidates of different parties, such as Florina Presadă (SENS), Diana Șoșoacă (SOS), Cosette Chichirău (DREPT), Cristian Terheș (PNCR), Szabo Odon (UDMR), and Alexandra Păcuraru (ADN), directly relates to the parliamentary elections. The post's objective is to inform the public about the candidates' positions on these issues, which can indirectly influence voting behavior.  The fact that it's a paid advertisement targeting a wide audience on a public platform further strengthens the argument that it constitutes electoral propaganda.  While presented as informative, the selection and framing of quotes could be interpreted as subtly promoting certain viewpoints and potentially swaying public opinion.  The lack of a CMF number does not automatically exclude it from being considered electoral propaganda, as the law focuses on the content and its potential impact.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Florina Presadă</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Diana Șoșoacă</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Cosette Chichirău</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Cristian Terheș</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Szabo Odon</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Alexandra Păcuraru</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>MozaiQ</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
MozaiQ, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări plătite pe Facebook (ID: 1125773355569863), după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care prezintă extrase din platformele unor partide politice referitoare la drepturile femeilor și LGBTQ+, cu citate de la candidați la alegerile parlamentare, având un efect electoral clar prin influențarea opiniei publice.  Postarea, cu o cheltuială de 400-499 RON și o audiență estimată la peste 1 milion de persoane,  nu se încadrează în excepțiile legale, deoarece, deși pare informativă, selecția și prezentarea citatelor pot fi interpretate ca o propagandă subtilă, influențând votul.  Citatele de la Florina Presadă (SENS), Diana Șoșoacă (SOS), Cosette Chichirău (DREPT), Cristian Terheș (PNCR), Szabo Odon (UDMR) și Alexandra Păcuraru (ADN) demonstrează legătura directă cu alegerile parlamentare.  Lipsa unui număr CMF nu exclude incriminarea, dat fiind efectul electoral al conținutului.  Contact: vladviski@mozaiqlgbt.ro, +40730924433, https://www.mozaiqlgbt.ro/.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
